ygData.subject: RE: level hell (quest spoilers kinda)
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm I schwacked Nerbilkk a couple levs ago - I thought he was white to me at 19/20 - I had a high lev wiz with me (could not have solo d him) - we were looking
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm I schwacked Nerbilkk a couple levs ago - I thought he was white to me at
19/20 - I had a high lev wiz with me (could not have solo'd him) - we were
looking for the Pirate Captn and just screwing around when we found
Nerblikk. His loot is kinda crazy - dwarf pickles and a recipe. And a
fishing spear - crazy stabber wep.

The recipe is an item needed for the Grobb Cleaver quest - hell how can this
be a spoiler if the quest guy tells you he wants it? Ok, so maybe the
location of this guy is the spoiler part. And how is a troll/ogre supposed
to get to the boats in east freeport any ways??? Could prolly sell the
recipe to some oger/troll interested in a Grobb Cleaver.

Might be time to go back and pay him another visit - esp if they nerf druid
kiting and we cant pull avo's any more. bard 24, mage 25 with pet, 25 druid
- druid finds and kites the avo down to basically very low hp then pulls him
to the pet. I barely have enough time to target and attack before the avo
is dead.

Otherwise get into groups in HighKeep Lookout room and guard room for lo to
mid 20's. Warrior room for later 20's and into 30's. It hack slask, rinse,
repeat, but it moves the bar.

Sylly.

-----Original Message-----
From: Llewrend Lynnhaven [mailto:lordartos@...]
Sent: Tuesday, September 07, 1999 8:46 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] level hell

From: Llewrend Lynnhaven <lordartos@...>

Ah, only to my bard friends do I release this info,
but there's a troll out in the OOT that you can solo
around 24 or so. May need to take one person, he'll
be on one of the rocks around the sirens. He got me
over the mid-20's slump. Unlike herman the hermit, I
never once got there and found him camped, and the
boat passes quite nearby to catch for a ride back to
FP. Hope that helps you get to the upper 20's anyway.
:)

Llewrend Lynnhaven
